meanings.definition: Wallydrags: to pull or drag something heavily or clumsily
meanings.sent1: The tired worker wallydrags the heavy boxes across the warehouse.
meanings.sent2: She wallydrags the suitcase up the stairs with great effort.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat wallydrags its toy mouse around the room.
meanings.sent4: The storm wallydrags the leaves across the yard in a chaotic dance.
meanings.sent5: The old car wallydrags its rusted frame down the bumpy road.

meanings.definition: Wallydrags: a person who is slow or lazy
meanings.sent1: The wallydrags took his time finishing the race.
meanings.sent2: She called him a wallydrags for always lounging around.
meanings.sent3: The wallydrags finally got up from the couch after hours of napping.
meanings.sent4: He was known as the office wallydrags for his lack of motivation.
meanings.sent5: The wallydrags yawned lazily as he strolled through the park.

meanings.definition: Wallydrags: an act of dragging something heavily or clumsily
meanings.sent1: The loud wallydrags of the chair across the floor echoed in the room.
meanings.sent2: She heard the wallydrags of the garbage can being pulled to the curb.
meanings.sent3: The wallydrags of the broom against the floor startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: The wallydrags of the anchor hitting the ocean floor signaled their arrival.
meanings.sent5: The wallydrags of the heavy bag being dragged up the stairs woke up the neighbors.
